intro: Callista xantholeuca, commonly known as the yellow-leaved callista, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun. Callista xantholeuca is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a houseplant.
